intro: Passerina virgata var. rodriguezi, commonly known as the Rodrigues starling, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant exhibits a shrub-like growth habit with slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in coastal and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
